main event: A witness in Macon, Georgia reported seeing a reddish-orange, glowing, egg-shaped object with a beam of light in front at about 55 degrees above the horizon on September 6, 1964. Later, two star-like objects were observed moving up, down, and side-to-side for about two hours.
interesting points: The initial object traveled in a straight line with a jerking, slow motion before speeding up and disappearing.
The two star-like objects moved in a 'W' pattern for about 15 inches.
The objects were observed between the 'Little Dipper' and the 'Morning Star' at an elevation of about 45-50 degrees above the horizon.
A police officer at Robins Air Force Base reported seeing a possible shooting star in the same general area around the time of the sightings.
The witnesses were sober and of sound mind, and their accounts were corroborated.
sighted object: a reddish-orange, glowing, egg-shaped object with a beam of light, and two star-like objects
